title: FTSE 100 drops again to lose £40billion as China fears resurface
text:
FTSE 100 drops again to lose £40billion as China fears resurface FTSE 100 drops again to lose £40billion as China fears resurface LONDON's leading share index has lost more than £40billion in this morning's trading as fears over China flare again. PUBLISHED: 10:03, Tue, Sep 1, 2015 | UPDATED: 10:08, Tue, Sep 1, 2015 AP Fears over China have hit investors in London again today 
The FTSE 100 dropped by 2.75 per cent on Tuesday morning, to hit as low as 6,073.38 and threatened to slide below the crucial 6,000 mark. The fall could wipe out the index's recovery made at the tail-end of last week, when the market managed to reverse some of the losses made during the previous 'Black Monday''s disastrous day of trading. The losses have been triggered by continued worries over China's stock market and economy. Data today showed that activity in China's factories shrank at its fastest rate in at least three years in August as domestic and export orders tumbled. The figures underlining fears that the world's second-largest economy is slowing faster than feared.Even worse, China's services sector, which has been one of the lone bright spots in the sputtering economy, also showed signs of cooling, according to a business survey.
